title: Join us today with the OPL winners, 6th April at 3PM AEST @TwitterAU’s #BlueRoom + Surprise Giveaways!
body:
The Split 1 OPL Finals concluded last night with a 3-2 victory for the Chiefs against long time rivals Legacy. But the Chiefs' journey doesn’t end here as they now prepare for the International WildCard Invitational (IWCI) in Mexico City on April 16-23rd, 2016. 

Shoutcaster Jake “Spawn” Tiberi will be joined by Swiffer & Spookz at Twitter's #BlueRoom today to discuss the OPL this year, and their chances at IWCI. Then we’ll pass the mic to you! Send in your questions to the pro players and Spawn. Questions will be answered live, with: 

* The top question as chosen by Swiffer & Spookz will win themselves a signed Logitech G105 Gaming Keyboard* by the entire Chiefs team.
* And the top question as chosen by Spawn will win themselves a signed Logitech G430 Surround gaming headset* by the entire Chiefs team.

You can either post your question below, or tweet them to [@LOL_Oceania](https://twitter.com/LOL_Oceania) with hashtag #IAMOCE. 

**So join us today at 3PM AEST (5PM NZST) and follow the [@LOL_Oceania Twitter feed](https://twitter.com/LOL_Oceania) to get an insider look into the [Chiefs'](https://twitter.com/ChiefsESC) preparation for IWCI + a chance to win prizes! **

http://i.imgur.com/UatYYhP.jpg

**Competition is only available to Oceanic players.*

replies.body: As non full-time professional players, how do you prioritise league with family, friends and work. Do you have a routine or schedule?
How many cans of redbull do you guys drink on average ? Weekly. :)
I drink around 2 cans of Redbull a day

As a major chiefs fan, I know you guys usually struggle later in the series. However, you all seemed to step up your game and keep a level head in the BO5. How much have you as a team matured mentally since IWCI 2015?

I would say we have improved significantly in bo series, we used to have issues with tilting mid-series but we really address team psychology mid series and make sure we're all feeling good heading in  to every game.
What other region's competitive League scenes do you guys watch? I feel like Spookz's playstyle is similar to Ambition from Samsung in the LCK.
I watch as much as international League as possible, I try mirror Korea jungle styles the most which is generally a more safe style that focuses on getting lanes ahead.
For the whole team, do you ever get stage fright or nervous before the games? If so, what are your remedies?
I think everyone gets pre-game jitters, for me specifically the first play typically  where I can yell and get hyphy removes all the nerves

with regards to the intensity of the final , how do you reckon you compare to the other teams participating at IWCI? including differences in meta and play style as well as  how do you as a team stand up to other talent or game plans, like focusing on bot lane? for example talent like Naru from supermassive
We know we can all compete individually overseas that won't be an issue, we just need to not let the event get to our heads and make sure we play to our best standards
During a game does your team prioritize high morale or rather focus on objectives and personal performances when trying to come back from a bad start?
No matter what state a game is in we're always discussing win-conditions, they obviously change based on who's ahead
If you could have one non-meta champion become meta who would it be?
Jungle Sona
How were you able to control the map throughout the games, even when it seemed like Legacy had the advantage.
It's typically just down to side wave control and pink ward coverage

How do you guys see yourselfs against big teams like SuperMassive eSports and INTZ e-Sports??

watching their finals felt like they were on top tier LCS level.

what does chief needs to overcome these powerhouses in the IWCI??

Hi Soul,

They're obviously classy teams, I think if we can stay level-headed and play our game we definitely have a chance to win. I feel we're strong enough to take matches against these teams. It's mainly going to come down to setting up properly for objectives and not making silly errors

:) Yes you did! 

Could you please [message me on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/RiotLittlemisscheeky) the best email address to reach you on? 

For those wanting the see the answer to dumpmasterdarius' question, [watch it here](https://twitter.com/LOL_Oceania/status/717608987793842177).
Thanks! Contacted you via fb :) names: Juhan :)
What do you think you're bringing to IWCI that will change the results of past OCE and in particular your own results on the international stage
Hey Dranger, in case you missed it, your question got answered! You can [watch the response here](https://twitter.com/LOL_Oceania/status/717610926128541696).

@Swiffer assuming Bangkok Titans win the GPL are you looking forward to having essentially a rematch with G4 at IWCI?
(in my opinion he seemed to be the only mid laner you struggled against)
How many wheat bix did Raydere eat for that penta kill.
Do you feel that the Legacy of Legacy is disappointment?

Have you ever thought of putting together a team comp and practicing champions that all are part of a skin team? Such as Pentakill, Pool Party, or all Pirates etc. If so, have you ever considered putting one of those comps forward into a pro match?
